value:
Loyalty is the first principle for a
knight. It can, however, preclude
action—and a knight must act.

Etruria is rich in history and naturally
abundant. That has bred stagnancy
and corruption.$k$pI will see it returned to glory.

Diligence is a virtue. But there is
such a thing as too much focus.
You should rest as necessary.

The fighting has gone on for so
long, yet you remain unarmed.
I am in awe of your courage.

No, I am not sad. I was merely
thinking. This is just my natural
expression.

I come to offer you my humble
respects, dispatched as a messenger
by $Nf.

Watch me demonstrate the pride
of an Etrurian knight!

I will continue to strive to fulfill
my duty as a knight.
I have failed you.
I will remain steadfast in my duty.

I am Perceval, Knight General of
Etruria. If war has visited this land,
I vow to lend you my strength.

I swore loyalty to my country.
I had girded myself to fight till
the very end.$k$pWar steals much from us. The earth
is itself scarred, the people starve.
The lot of the weak is made harsher.$k$pAnd the country, well... Its sovereignty,
once lost, is not easily recovered.
A war must be ended quickly.$k$pI know you are not a knight. Yet I
wanted to foment understanding,
as comrades in battle.$k$pWe must fight with pride and protect
the powerless. That is the knightly
ideal, at the least.$k$pLet us walk into battle together—
our heads held high.
せいっ
てやあ！
くっ…
いかん…！
How reckless.
Withdraw while you can!
I've no choice then!
I'll stake my life!
I have no regrets...
Hmph.
I am Perceval, proud Knight General of Etruria.
What?! You dar—? No...perhaps you are merely confused.
I will see my home country of Etruria restored—and more prosperous than ever.
We must end this war soon. For the sake of all those who cannot defend themselves.
I have been told my face lacks expression. Do you...agree with that?
I have pledged my blade to my lord Prince Myrddin—and to him alone.
You are...beyond my understanding... Of course, I intend no offense.
Naturally.
Fair enough.
It will be so!
